messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] game systems
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/4/02 7:42:58 PM, starsuncloud@cs.com writes:  Kirby says it s an adventure game, not role playing, because the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/4/02 7:42:58 PM, starsuncloud@... writes:

<< But what about Zelda? >>

Kirby says it's an adventure game, not role playing, because the character of
Link can't be changed. Role playing (sayeth Kirby) involves characters whose
attributes are variable. "You gain levels and experience," says Eric.
Eric (a regular who is available, while Kirby is not) says Zelda is an
adventure game, and a puzzle game.

The new game Kirby bought is for Gamecube, not 64. It's Lost Kingdoms.

Sandra

messages.subject: game systems
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/4/02 7:28:43 PM Central Daylight Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/4/02 7:28:43 PM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Kirby complained that
there were NO role playing games for 64 >>

But what about Zelda? Trevor loves the Zelda RPG's. Is that the only RPG for
Nintendo? He wants the XBox AND a PS2........We're destined to become a
technology rich family.
Ren
